intro: Crusea hispidula, commonly known as the hairy crusea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
